data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update Impacts and Analysis
data.Description: The August 2024 Google Core Update has impacted a significant number of websites, many of which were also affected by previous updates in March 2024 and September 2023.  Analysis and observations of the update are being shared widely within the SEO community.

data.Title: Google Search Results Page (SERP) Features Updated
data.Description: Google has combined the "Latest Posts" and "Article Carousel" into a single "Latest Posts" carousel in search results. This consolidated carousel now includes both articles and social media posts.

data.Title: Mediavine Bans Publisher for Excessive AI-Generated Content
data.Description: Mediavine has taken action against a publisher for overusing AI-generated content, signaling a firm stance against low-quality AI content and its potential impact on advertising partnerships.

data.Title: YouTube Studio Enhances Promotions with Website Visits Goal
data.Description: YouTube Studio now allows businesses to set website visits as a goal for their promotions, making it easier to drive traffic from YouTube channels directly to their websites.

data.Title: Microsoft Partners with StopNCII to Combat Deepfakes on Bing
data.Description: Microsoft is taking steps to remove abusive deepfake content from Bing search results by partnering with StopNCII. This initiative aims to identify and eliminate AI-generated explicit imagery, including deepfakes.

data.Title: DOJ and Google Head to Court in Second Antitrust Battle
data.Description: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) and Google are set for another round in their ongoing antitrust fight, this time focusing on Google's advertising business practices. The trial is scheduled to begin on September 9th.

data.Title: Judge Delays Decision on Remedies in Google Monopoly Case
data.Description: The judge overseeing the Google monopoly ruling has announced a delay in determining remedies, pushing the decision to August 2025. Potential remedies could include restrictions on Google's search engine on mobile devices or even a breakup of the company.
